title: Integration Studio—SAP SuccessFactors integration
content:
This topic introduces the integration between Service Management and SAP SuccessFactors through the following set of illustrated use cases. Each use case corresponds to an out-of-the-box scenario template for the integration.

  • Create new SuccessFactors users
  • Create requests for new hires
  • Get employee position information
  • Get holiday balance

Use cases

 
The integration use cases described in this document serve as examples to inspire and guide your integration efforts. However, they should not be considered as prescriptive or guaranteed solutions for your particular scenario. The examples may or may not be applicable to your license edition.

Use case 1: Create new SuccessFactors users

This use case describes how to start the onboarding process for a new employee in SAP SuccessFactors.

Paul goes to the Service Portal and selects the Create new employee account in Service Management and SAP Success Factors offering. Paul enters all required data and submits the request to get the onboarding process started in the HR system.

The system registers the request in Service Management and starts the onboarding process in SAP SuccessFactors.

Use case 2: Create requests for new hires

The Create requests for new hires scenario is a scheduled integration scenario that queries SucessFactor for users who will come onboard in a given number of days, and then creates a request for an offering bundle for each user found.

For more information about this offering bundle and the use case, see HR SM use case: New hire onboarding with the onboarding bundle.

Use case 3: Get employee position information

In this use case, Pete asks Aviator, the AI virtual agent, what his employee ID is in the Service Management Service Portal.

Step 1: Accessing the Portal

Pete logs in to the Service Portal, where he knows he can have access to a variety of self-service support features, such as catalog, knowledge, and subscription management for the applications he uses every day.

Step 2: Submitting a request

Pete proceeds to get help from Aviator, specifying that he would like to find out his employee ID.

Aviator recognizes the question and confirms with Pete that he would like to check his employee position information.

Step 3: Resolution

Once Pete confirms, a Request is created, and the SAP SuccessFactors integration automatically fulfills it. After a couple of seconds, Pete receives the information he was looking for.

Use case 4: Get holiday balance

In this sample use case, Pete is asking Max, the virtual agent, about his current holiday balance by using the Service Management Service Portal.

In this sample use case, Pete is asking Max, the virtual agent, about his current holiday balance by using the Service Management Service Portal.

Step 1: Accessing the Portal

Pete logs in to the Service Portal, where he knows he can have access to a variety of self-service support features, such as catalog, knowledge, and subscription management for the applications he uses every day.

Step 2: Submitting a request

Pete proceeds to get help from Max, specifying that he would like to find out where he can see his current holiday balance.

Max gives quick access to the available services. Pete selects the desired request and submits his question.

Step 3: Resolution

Behind the scenes, the SAP SuccessFactors integration automatically fulfills the request. After a couple of seconds, Pete receives the solution to his request.

Set up the integration

The procedure below will set up the integration with SAP SuccessFactors to achieve the documented example use cases.

Prepare an integration user

Perform the following steps to prepare an integration user:

  1. Create an integration user. See How to create an integration user.

  2. Log in to the Agent Portal of Service Management as the tenant admin, navigate to Administration > Master Data > People, locate the integration user, and then assign the proper role to grant access to the required modules. Example: Service Request Agent.

    Alternatively, add the Tenant Admin role to grant general access.

Create an endpoint

As a prerequisite, register Service Management as an OAuth2 client application in the Admin Center of SAP SuccessFactors. For details, see the SAP SuccessFactors documentation.

Then,  create an endpoint by using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type.

  1. Log in to the Agent Portal as the tenant admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, SuccessFactors), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.

  5. Click Configure and complete the following fields.

    Field Value
    Agent

    Select Agentless for a direct connection to SAP SuccessFactors.
    Authentication type Select SAP SuccessFactors OAuth 2.0.
    Protocol Select https.
    Base URL

    Enter the URL of the SAP SuccessFactors API Server. Example: https://apiyy.successfactors.com/

    Check here to find the API Server of your instance.
    Token URL

    Enter the token URL from which you request the OAuth token for SuccessFactors: https://<api-server>/oauth/token
    Company ID Enter the company ID obtained from the SuccessFactors Admin Center.
    Client ID Enter the API key generated in the SuccessFactors Admin Center.
    User ID Enter the user ID that can access the application. The user ID is the same as the one configured in the SuccessFactors Admin Center.
    Private key

    Enter the private key of the X.509 certificate configured or generated in the SuccessFactors Admin Center.

    Note that when copying the private key,  copy the key content only without the beginning (-----BEGIN ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----) and ending (-----END ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----) lines.
    Certificate type Leave it empty.
    Certificate format Leave it empty.
    Server certificate

    Leave it empty.

Create an integration

Create an integration and configure scenarios to define the business logic of the documented use cases.

Perform the following steps to create an integration based on the SuccessFactors connector.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select SuccessFactors (under SAP) as the connector, select the SuccessFactors endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Add and configure scenarios

The SAP SuccessFactors connector has the following pre-defined scenario templates:

  • Create new SuccessFactors users
  • Create requests for new hires
  • Get employee position information
  • Get holiday balance
 
Using templates will make your integration configuration easier than starting from scratch. If you don't select this option, you'll have to manually add your own logic, starting from a blank page.

Add the scenarios

Perform the following steps to add the scenarios using the pre-defined templates:

  1. Click Add scenario.
  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, enter Get holiday balance.
  3. In the Template field, select a scenario template. For example, select Get holiday balance (under SAP SuccessFactors) from the list.
  4. Click Save to add the scenario.
  5. Repeat the steps above to add any other required scenarios.

Configure the scenarios

Configure the scenarios by changing the parameter values in the scenario rules.

Create new SuccessFactors users scenario

Enter the following details in the specified rules:

  • In the “Settings” rule at the start of the process logic section, enter the user ID of the Service Management integration user.
  • In the “Onboarding specific settings (demo purpose)” rule, enter the correct data for the SAP SuccessFactors instance you integrate with. All this data is required to start the onboarding process. The provided data is demo data only and may not match the data of your SAP SuccessFactors instance.
Create requests for new hires scenario

In the “Settings” rule at the start of the process logic section, enter the following details:

  • (Optional) Days. The default value is 20 days. Modify this value if you want requests to be created at a different number of days before new employees start work.
Get employee position information scenario

No configuration required.

Get holiday balance scenario

In the “Settings” rule at the start of the process logic section, enter the following details:

  • The user ID of the Service Management integration user.
  • (Optional) The time account type to get balance from.
  • (Optional) The Service Management property for storing username. You can change the default value ('RequestedByPerson') if you store the username in a different property.

Configure the offerings

The offerings that are used by each of the scenarios require no further configuration in order to run the use cases described here. However, you can modify any of them to meet your specific needs.

Scenario Offering to update
Create new SuccessFactors users

Create new employee account in Service Management and SAP SuccessFactors

(Employee lifecycle > Recruitment and Onboarding)
Create requests for new hires

Employee onboarding bundle

(Employee Lifecycle > Recruitment and Onboarding)
Get employee position information

Check employee position information

(Employee Lifecycle > Personal Employee Data)
Get holiday balance

Check current holiday balance

(Travel and Time Off > Leave of Absence Management)

Understand the scenarios

The following section describes the logic of the scenario rules, so that you can customize the scenario as needed.

Scenario 1: Create new SuccessFactors users

Rule Purpose Comments
Settings Defines general settings required in the scenario. Set the parameters as described in the "Configure the scenarios" section.
Onboarding specific settings

Defines additional parameters required for the onboarding.

Examples: Company, JobCode, PayScale.

The values in the template are example values only. These settings may not work in your SuccessFactors instance.

Review and replace the values with the correct data in your SuccessFactors instance.
SMAX: Get request details Gets the request details.  
SMAX: Get person record Gets the Service Management Person record. The first task in the task plan for the offering creates the Person record. This rule queries the Person record type based on the UPN defined in the user option field to get all the data entered in the offering.
Prepare employee data Prepares the data for SuccessFactors.

Make sure the data meets the SuccessFactors requirements, like Country or Nationality. A basic mapping for some properties, such as Nationality, is implemented and can be extended.

The DataComplete property checks if all required data is complete.
SuccessFactors: Create onboarding process Creates the onboarding process. This rule runs only when DataComplete is “yes”.
SuccessFactors: Upsert person entity Upserts the person entity This rule runs only when the "create onboarding" rule succeeds.
SuccessFactors: Upsert employment entity Upserts the employment entity. This rule runs only when the "upsert person" rule succeeds.
SuccessFactors: Upsert job entity Upserts the job entity. This rule runs only when the "upsert employment" rule succeeds.
SuccessFactors: Upsert personal entity Upserts the personal entity. This rule runs only when the "upsert job" rule succeeds.
SuccessFactors: Initiate onboarding process Initiates the onboarding process. This rule runs only when the "upsert personal" rule succeeds.
SMAX: Add comment to request Adds a comment to the Service Management request record.  

Scenario 2: Create requests for new hires

Rule Purpose Comments
Settings Defines general settings required in the scenario. Set the parameters as described in the "Configure the scenarios" section.
Prepare data Prepares the data for SuccessFactors.  
SuccessFactors: Get onboarding employees Gets the list of onboarding employees.  
Get offering Id Gets the offering id by offering's displaylabel. This rule runs only when the "get onboarding employees" rule succeeds.
Iterate through onboarding employees
  • Gets person data
  • Checks if request already exists
  • Creates requests based on offerings
 This rule runs only when the "get offering id" rule succeeds.

Scenario 3: Get employee position information

Rule Purpose Comments
Settings Defines general settings required in the scenario.  
SuccessFactors: Get user Id based on email Gets the SuccessFactors user ID based on the email of the Service Management user.  
Prepare query parameters Prepares the OData query filters to query the employee position information. This rule runs only when the "get user id based on email" rule succeeds.
SuccessFactors: Get employee data Queries the employee data (employee ID, location, position title, and service date). This rule runs only when the "get user id based on email" rule succeeds.
Prepare data Prepares the data to update the request in Service Management. This rule runs only when the "get employee data" rule succeeds.
Update request Solution and Completion Code fields Updates the Solution and Completion code fields for the request. This rule runs only when the employee position data was successfully queried.
Create comment Adds a comment to the request.  

Scenario 4: Get holiday balance

Rule Purpose Comments
Settings Defines general settings required in the scenario.

Set the parameters as described in the "Configure the scenarios" section.
SMAX: Get record details Gets the request details.  
SuccessFactors: Get user id based on email Gets the SuccessFactors user ID based on the email of the Service Management user. In case the SuccessFactors userId is the same as the UPN in Service Management, this step might be skipped.
Prepare query parameters Prepares the OData query parameters to query the holiday balance.

The filter requires the userId and TimeAccountType. BalanceOf is optional and is set to the current timestamp.
SuccessFactors: Get holiday balance Queries the holiday balance. Ensure the user has proper permission to query the entity "EmpTimeAccountBalance" in SuccessFactors.
Common: Prepare data for update Prepares the data to update the request in Service Management.  
SMAX: Update request Updates the Solution and Completion code fields for the request. This rule only runs when the holiday balance was successfully queried.
SMAX: Create comment Adds a comment to the request.  
 
You must keep the order of the rules set in the create requests for new hires template.
